titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1399_18
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1399_18

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

Restored full text of the inscription:
w-sḥr ydʿʾb ḏbyn bn šhr mlk qtbn w-qtbn mśwdn
w-fqḍtn w-btln w-rdmn w-ʾlmlk w-mḍḥym w-yḥr w-bklmy-w-ḏ-
tn w-bklnhn w-kl ʾšʿbm ymlk ydʿʾb bn mʾtmm w-ʾmm
m ʾḫ-s bn qtbn w-ḏtn ʾšʿbn w-l yḥrm sw ʾnsn hrgn
knm b-yṯfṭ-s w-sḥr w-sʿbr w-ṣry mlkn bn tmnʿ w-
kr brṯm w-mʿbrm ġyr brṯm b-ysḥr-s w-sʿbr w-ṣry m=
lkn l-ymt sw ʾnsn mstʿdwn knm b-ykśʾ w-ḥlt nfs-s
gs mwt ʾw mʿbr b-nfs mstʿdwn ʾsmʿm
wrḫ-s ḏ-mslʿt ḫrf ġwṯʾl ḏ-ġ=
f hgrn tmnʿ w-wʿln w-śyrm w-
ṯfṭ w-ḥrg mlkn bn hgr ʾšʿb ʿm w-ḏm b-yhrg f-l
ʾrḍm b-s b-yhrg nḥql bn ʾrbʿ ywmytm n-l yntwḥ ʿd
mʿbrn ʿd-km b-yṣry-s mlkn knm b-yʿbr w-ḥwr w-tʿlm-ʾy y=
d šhr w-tʿlm-ʾy ʾydw zydm ḏ-ẓrb ḏ-ḏrʾn w-šhrm d-ḏrʾn w-ṣbḥkrb ḏ-hrn
mškrm ḏ-ġrbm w-ḏrʾkrb bn ḥnẓt w-gyrm ḏ-šhr w-hwfʿm bn
ḏ-ygr w-ʿmyṯʿ ḏ-ršm w-lḥyʿṯt mʿhr w-ḍbʾm bn zḫnn w-hwfʿṯt n=
bn mʿhr w-ʾbšbm bn ʾʿsyfr w-ḏydm ġrbn w-ʿmḏḫr glgln w-hwtrʿṯt
hwfʿm ḏ-hṣbḥ w-ʿmḏḫr ḏ-šrgn w-ʾbšfq ḏ-hrmw w-ʾbšfq bn gʾnn w-lśb
w-yṯʿkrb yʾḏn w-nbṭʿly bn hṯb ršḥm w-ʿmkrb bn ṣbḥm w-smydʿ ḏ-gʿrn
šfq ḏ-yfʿm w-mʿdʾl ḏ-nḍrn w-nbṭʿm bn ṭwyn w-yʿgf ḏ-yʿgf w-ḏydm ḏ-ʿgḏ w-ʿ=
ḏ-hṯʿr lḥy w-ʿmʾmn ḫbḏn w-smydʿ ṭn.zm w-ynfʾ ḏ-rft w-nbṭʿm ḏ-ḏrḥn

w-sḥr ydʿʾb ḏbyn bn šhr mlk qtbn w-qtbn mśwdn
w-fqḍtn w-btln w-rdmn w-ʾlmlk w-mḍḥym w-yḥr w-bklmy-w-ḏ-
tn w-bklnhn w-kl ʾšʿbm ymlk ydʿʾb bn mʾtmm w-ʾmm

wrḫ-s ḏ-mslʿt ḫrf ġwṯʾl ḏ-ġ=
f hgrn tmnʿ w-wʿln w-śyrm w-
ṯfṭ w-ḥrg mlkn bn hgr ʾšʿb ʿm w-ḏm b-yhrg f-l
ʾrḍm b-s b-yhrg nḥql bn ʾrbʿ ywmytm n-l yntwḥ ʿd
mʿbrn ʿd-km b-yṣry-s mlkn knm b-yʿbr w-ḥwr w-tʿlm-ʾy y=
d šhr w-tʿlm-ʾy ʾydw zydm ḏ-ẓrb ḏ-ḏrʾn w-šhrm d-ḏrʾn w-ṣbḥkrb ḏ-hrn

ḏ-ygr w-ʿmyṯʿ ḏ-ršm w-lḥyʿṯt mʿhr w-ḍbʾm bn zḫnn w-hwfʿṯt n=

hwfʿm ḏ-hṣbḥ w-ʿmḏḫr ḏ-šrgn w-ʾbšfq ḏ-hrmw w-ʾbšfq bn gʾnn w-lśb

Text preserved in this squeeze:
3.[... ... … … …] 4.[... ...] and these tribes [… … … …] 5.[... ...] the king examines and declares [... ... ... ...] 6.[... ...] on the spot he decrees it [...] and declares [..] 7.[... ...] [... ... … ... ... …] 8.[... ... … ... ... …] 9.[... ... … ... ... …] 10.[... ... ... ...] Śayrum [..] 11.[... ... ... ... ... ...] 12.[... ... ... ... f]our days, then let [... ...] 13.[... ... ...] so shall he examine and promulgate. And [...] has signed (this) in his own 14.[... ... ...Ṣa]baḥkarib [... ...] 15.[... ... … ... ... …] 16.[... ... … ... ... …]
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[... ...]and ordained Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people and the council 2.and (the tribes of) Faqḍatān and Batlān and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklamay and Dhū-Th[... …] 3.[... ...] and Bakīlānhān and all of the (other) tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison and as a group, 4.[... ...] his fellow tribesman from Qatabān and these tribes, let that individual who has killed be anathematized 5.[... ...] the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from Tamnaʿ and 6.[... ...] on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares 7.[... ...] let that individual die who commits and offense against this which has been settled, for his life may legally be taken 8.[... ...] death or examination (regarding) the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses 9.[... ... the mon]th of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh- 10.[... ...] the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and 11.[... ...] the king […] judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let 12.[... ...] a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until 13.[... ...] the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed (this) in his own 14.hand. And (so too) have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān 15.[... ...] Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin 16.[... ... Dhū-]Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N= 17.[... ...] bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat 18.[... ...] Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib 19.[... ...] and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān 20.[... ...sha]faq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA= 21.[... ...] Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan[.]zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.

and these tribes … … … …
the king examines and declares
on the spot he decrees it ... and declares ..
… …
… …
… …
Śayrum ..
four days, then let

… …

Restored full text of the inscription:
and ordained Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin Shahr, King of Qatabān, and the Qatabānian people and the council
and the tribes of Faqḍatān and Batlān and Radmān and ʾĪlmalak and Maḍḥayyum and Yaḥirr and Baklamay and Dhū-Th... …
and Bakīlānhān and all of the other tribes over which Yadaʿʾab rules, in unison and as a group,
his fellow tribesman from Qatabān and these tribes, let that individual who has killed be anathematized
the king judges it and ordains and examines and declares from Tamnaʿ and
on the spot and an examination in absentia, which the king decrees and examines and declares
let that individual die who commits and offense against this which has been settled, for his life may legally be taken
death or examination regarding the life of the one who commits an offense. The witnesses
the month of Masaʿlāt of the year of Ghawthʾīl Dhū-Gh-
the town of Tamnaʿ and Waʿlān and Śayrum and
the king … judges and decrees from the town of the tribes of ʿAmm. And whoever kills, let
a land in which he kills, specifically within four days, then let them mourn until
the examination until such time as the king declares, so shall he examine and promulgate. And Shahr has signed this in his own
hand. And so too have signed in their own hands Zaydum Dhū-Ẓarib Dhū-Dharaʾān and Shahrum Dhū-Dharaʾān and Ṣabaḥkarib Dhū-Hirrān
Mashkarum Dhū-Gharībam and Dharaʾkarib bin Ḥanẓat and Gayrum Dhū-Shahr and Hawfāʿamm bin
Dhū-Yagirr and ʿAmmīyathaʿ Dhū-Rashīm and Laḥayʿathat Maʿāhir and Ḍabʾum bin Zikhnān and Hawfāʿathat N=
bin Maʿāhir and ʾAbīshibām bin ʾAʿsāyfir and Dhaydum Gharībān and ʿAmmīdhakhar Gulgulān and Hawtarʿathat
Hawfāʿamm Dhū-Haṣbaḥ and ʿAmmīdhakhar Dhū-Shirgān and ʾAbīshafaq Dhū-Harmaw and ʾAbīshafaq bin Giʾnān and Laśib
and Yithāʿkarib Yiʾdhān and Nabaṭʿalī bin Hathib Rishḥum and ʿAmmīkarib bin Ṣabāḥum and Sumūyadaʿ Dhū-Guʿrān
shafaq Dhū-Yāfiʿam and Maʿdʾīl Dhū-Naḍīrān and Nabaṭʿamm bin Ṭawiyyān and Yaʿgif Dhū-Yaʿgif and Dhaydum Dhū-ʿAgidh and ʿA=
Dhū-Hathʿar Laḥay and ʿAmmīʾamīn Khabidhān and Sumūyadaʿ Ṭan.zum and Yinfaʾ Dhū-Rafit and Nabaṭʿamm Dhū-Dharaḥān.
